message_2:
To solve the inequality 5x - 12 > 3x + 8, we need to isolate x on one side of the inequality. 

Step 1: Subtract 3x from both sides of the inequality.
5x - 3x - 12 > 3x - 3x + 8
2x - 12 > 8

Step 2: Add 12 to both sides of the inequality.
2x - 12 + 12 > 8 + 12
2x > 20

Step 3: Divide both sides of the inequality by 2.
2x / 2 > 20 / 2
x > 10

So the solution to the inequality is x > 10.
